Operation 'post_/verifyPasswordChange' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary conflates 'forgot password' with the verification step. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (reset code, new password), expected output, and side effects (token/session invalidation). Improved version clarifies this is the verification step, specifies inputs/outputs, and documents session invalidation for security.

data.current_summary: Used for resetting your password when you forgot it
data.current_description: Another endpoint will generate a password reset code for you. You should use the client app to submit the reset code along with the new password to change your password.
data.summary_suggestion: Verify and apply password reset with code
data.description_suggestion: Completes the password reset process by verifying the password reset code and applying the new password. Requires the reset code (generated by /requestPasswordReset) and the new password as inputs. Returns confirmation of successful password change. Invalidates all existing password reset tokens and active sessions upon successful completion.
data.reasoning: Original summary conflates 'forgot password' with the verification step. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (reset code, new password), expected output, and side effects (token/session invalidation). Improved version clarifies this is the verification step, specifies inputs/outputs, and documents session invalidation for security.

message: Operation 'post_/changePassword' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is too generic. Description is incomplete - missing authentication requirement, return value, and side effects. Improved version clarifies authentication requirement, specifies both inputs, documents return value, and explains session invalidation behavior for security context.

data.current_description: Pass in your old password and your new password
data.description_suggestion: Allows an authenticated user to change their password by providing their current password and desired new password. Requires valid authentication token. Returns confirmation of successful password change. Invalidates all active sessions for the user upon successful completion.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description is incomplete - missing authentication requirement, return value, and side effects. Improved version clarifies authentication requirement, specifies both inputs, documents return value, and explains session invalidation behavior for security context.

message: Operation 'post_/requestPasswordReset' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, unclear_purpose. Summary is vague about who performs the action and the actual output. Description contains implementation rationale that obscures the core operation. Improved version clarifies admin-initiated workflow, specifies input (user ID), output (reset code), and the relationship to /verifyPasswordChange endpoint. Removes implementation philosophy to focus on operational clarity for AI agents.

data.current_summary: Used for requesting a password reset code
data.current_description: The admin should run this on behalf of a user who forgot their password. The API will generate a password reset code which the admin should then provide to the user. The user can use their client to reset their password. Normally the password reset code is mailed to the user, but I didn't want to do this in this case because I didn't want to introduce the complicated dependency of having an SMTP server just for this purpose. Doing it this way makes it easy for people to adopt this API.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate password reset code for user
data.description_suggestion: Generates a password reset code for a user who has forgotten their password. Intended for admin use - the admin provides the user ID and receives a reset code to manually deliver to the user. The user then uses this code with /verifyPasswordChange to complete the password reset. Returns the reset code in the response. Note: Reset codes are not automatically emailed; admins must manually communicate the code to users.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague about who performs the action and the actual output. Description contains implementation rationale that obscures the core operation. Improved version clarifies admin-initiated workflow, specifies input (user ID), output (reset code), and the relationship to /verifyPasswordChange endpoint. Removes implementation philosophy to focus on operational clarity for AI agents.

data.current_description: Use this endpoint to create a team member (user) record
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new team member user record
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new team member user account. Requires user details (name, email, etc.) as input. Returns the created userRecord object containing the new user ID and account information. The created user will need to set their password before first login.
data.reasoning: Summary lacks domain context ('team member'). Description is too brief - missing input requirements and output details. Improved version specifies this creates team member accounts, indicates required inputs, documents return value (userRecord schema), and clarifies password setup requirement for AI agent workflow understanding.

message: Operation 'post_/logout' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Current description is vague about authentication requirements and side effects. Enhanced version clarifies that TokenHeader authentication is required, explains the side effect (session termination), and indicates that future requests will fail without re-authentication. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full impact.

data.current_description: Log out by deleting your token off the server.
data.description_suggestion: Invalidates the current authentication token by removing it from the server. Requires a valid TokenHeader. After logout, subsequent requests without a new token will be rejected. This operation terminates the authenticated session.
data.reasoning: Current description is vague about authentication requirements and side effects. Enhanced version clarifies that TokenHeader authentication is required, explains the side effect (session termination), and indicates that future requests will fail without re-authentication. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full impact.

data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a signin record identified by signinId. Requires authentication via TokenHeader and a valid signinId path parameter. Returns a success confirmation. This operation removes the contact tracing record from the system and cannot be undone. Use with caution as deleted records cannot be recovered.
